desc: The system of how money, goods, and services are produced and used.
example: The global economy is recovering slowly.

desc: A place or system for buying and selling goods or services.
example: He sells vegetables at the local market.

desc: The activity of making, buying, or selling goods or services.
The management of money, especially by governments or businesses.
The act of putting money into something to make a profit.
example: Real estate is a common type of investment.

desc: The money a business earns after costs are paid.
example: Their profit grew by 20% last year.

desc: When a business spends more money than it earns.
example: The company reported a loss this quarter.

desc: Money paid to the government from income or sales.
example: You must pay income tax every year.

desc: An institution that manages money, loans, and savings.
example: She keeps her money in a local bank.

desc: A record of financial transactions held at a bank.
example: I opened a new savings account yesterday.
